title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
Hello,
I have a Macbook A2141 that came in for "Not Getting On".

It draws 20V on the amp meter. Customer showed it to some shop and they said that it is a SSD Issue. 

I can see a few Caps repalced like C9589 / C9587.

Can we verify if its actually a SSD issue or not or if it can be brought back to life.

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
Compare diode mode readings on SSD power lines with good board.
What voltages did you check on the MLB?

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
PPBUS_G3H is 12.6V.
PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 is 2.5V
PPBUS_G3H_SSD0_SNS is 12.6V.

SSD Power Rails Means all 0v9 , 1v8 and 2v5 SSD Lines as per the schematics right ?

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
Yes.

No need to check other PPBUS points; can't get different readings.

I expected some voltage reading on the big coils; RAM, PCH, CPU...

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
Diode Mode Readings of SSD Power Rails

L9521 is .352
L9520 is .310
L9530 IS .311
L9021 IS .391
L9020 IS.398
L9030 IS .345
R9520 IS .298
L9080 IS .334
C9091 IS .351

Voltage Readings of the Big Coils
L7410 0V
L7420 0V
L7211 0V
L7221 0V
L7231 0V
L7330 0V
LA750 0V
LA850 0V
LA860 0V
LA870 0V
LA950 0V
LA710/720/730/740 0V

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message: I don't see any mention about L6960, L7600/60, L7701, L8102.

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
It should be detected in DFU.
If no data to save, go for restore.

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
the machine was detected in recovery mode. Forced it into DFU Mode. But it shows an error during restore Invalid State.
Then it automatically went into Recovery Again, did a restore again. I got a apple logo with loading bar (almost 90% Full already).
It is stuck half way at Step 4 of 4 : Installing System

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message: Gave up waiting for device to transition from RestoreOS state to BootedOS state.  [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore – 0xFC9 (4041)]

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
Use 96/140W charger.
Connect charger cable before DFU cable.
Also let the battery connected too.

Force machine off and start in DFU, not recovery.

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message: Last Restore was with Battery Connected. I ll try it tomorrow and update

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
Followed the instructions but i got this error.
Device added from invalid state Restoring - This means that either we got a disconnection during restore, or we got the connect event twice [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore – 0xFAA (4010)]

One more thing. When i pluggged in the charger first (battery connected) i got a brief Battery sign and fan spin.

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message: It again showed up in recovery mode. This time with the charger plugged in i did a restore and it was successful. The machine got on with the question mark folder. Doing an internet recovery . Updating when done.

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message: The internet recovery did not complete Machine heats up and fan goes to max and shuts down. What should i do?

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
Are you using 96/140W charger?
The battery takes charge?
Any error pops up starting in diagnostic mode?

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
I am using a 96W charger.
I assume its taking charge as the device is running off the battery alone.

Diagnostics Mode - 

No Issue Found
ADP000

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
Try again Internet recovery.
May have more luck using ethernet cable.

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message: Okay. Let me try that too. If that doesnt work then Non Repairable?

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message: Did it with an ethernet cable. It got much further this time. But again the same thing.

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message:
Very likely no solution in this case.
May has SSD problems, or GPU, even CPU.

title: Macbook A2141 820-01700 SSD ISsue
message: okay
